title: Stuck at Preparing to download
body:
- [x] I've asked for help in the [Truffle Gitter](http://gitter.im/Consensys/truffle) before filing this issue.

I did, but didn't get an immediate response and I'm moving on for now and didn't want the question lost.

---------------------------

## Issue
Attempting to `truffle init` on Windows in Powershell prompt stalls indefinitely on `Preparing to download`.

## Steps to Reproduce
```
mkdir truffle
cd truffle
npm install truffle
npx truffle init
```

## Expected Behavior
Truffle to initialize the directory.

## Actual Results
```
This directory is non-empty...
? Proceed anyway? Yes
- Preparing to download
```

## Environment

* Operating System: Windows 10
* terminal: Powershell
* Ethereum client: N/A
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): v5.0.15
* node version (`node --version`): v10.15.0
* npm version (`npm --version`): 6.4.1

@MicahZoltu Hmm, so do you get an error or does it just hang? It seems that part of the code is attempting to create a temporary directory for downloading the unbox files. Does the spinner keep spinning?

It just hangs there indefinitely.  There is no spinner, if the leading hyphen is supposed to be animated to look like a spinner that isn't happening.

ctrl-c also doesn't terminate the process, I have to kill it.
I have the same issue

Yes that leading hyphen is supposed to be a spinner...I wonder if there could be something up with that library. The package is ora. I'll see what I can dig up.
A colleague of mine that uses a Windows computer was able to successfully do a `truffle init` with Powershell. I'll see what version of Windows he is using.
We just released v5.0.17. Can you download the most recent version and confirm that it is still an issue with that version?
@eggplantzzz Same problem with `v5.0.17`.
Same here, tried .v5.0.15 /16 / 17
Works with -global NPM install. It may seem its compatibility with NPX?
Hmm I'm not sure why it wouldn't work with npx but could be...

My colleague was able to duplicate your issue on both Powershell and Git Bash. It looks like this is specific to using `npx`. Global installs of Truffle don't seem to have the same issue. We'll have to look into this. Thanks for reporting!
This just happened to me too in my linux machine... spinner is moving but the download is stuck
@alanbleier182 I suspect that is a different issue.  The issue I'm running into appears to be the installer completely locking up the process in some blocking operation.

I have same issue, window Version	10.0.17763 Build 17763, truffle is v5.0.17.

> truffle init

This directory is non-empty...
? Proceed anyway? Yes
- Preparing to download

and got stuck

I had the same error three times this evening.

To resolve, I navigated to the directory (my project folder) where I was running truffle init from. Deleted all the files, then tried running truffle init in that folder again.

It works.
The above workaround doesn't work for me.  as seen in the repro case in the ticket description, I run into this problem even with a brand new directory.
@MicahZoltu Is it with a global truffle install or are you using npx to run the local package? Are you also on Windows?
Local install and npx.

@MicahZoltu can you give `npx truffle@unbundled-solc` and/or `npm i truffle@unbundled-solc`  a try? 🙏

(experimental prerelease hoping to solve this kind of problem 🤞 )

> I had the same error three times this evening.
> 
> To resolve, I navigated to the directory (my project folder) where I was running truffle init from. Deleted all the files, then tried running truffle init in that folder again.
> 
> It works.

It works too
@Taro0329 can you give `npx truffle@unbundled-solc` and/or `npm i truffle@unbundled-solc` a try?

I tried npm truffle install.
Both in command prompt with admin rights and Git bash.

It fails even if I have 1 renamed/old/unrelated folder in the directory.
Empty directory, not getting stuck downloading.

I've gotten past that but fail with trying to install another package
(HDwallet)

Great! Thanks for trying that out @zaidmo123

@CruzMolina The following does not work (same symptoms):
```
mkdir truffle
cd truffle
# create `package.json` file with `{}` in it
npm install truffle@unbundled-solc
npx truffle init
```
Thanks for checking that @MicahZoltu. On a stable release of truffle, if you globally install and then try the above, do you still get the same buggy behavior?

The following works:
```
mkdir truffle
cd truffle
npm install -g truffle
npx truffle init
```

Hmm, looks like this is what was noticed in: https://github.com/trufflesuite/truffle/issues/1996#issuecomment-491864416

Potentially a Windows `npx` local caching/path issue.

> The following works:
> 
> ```
> mkdir truffle
> cd truffle
> npm install -g truffle
> npx truffle init
> ```

@MicahZoltu  did it work for you?
@4Maarifa Yes.  Doing a global install of Truffle works fine.  Doing a local install of Truffle (and using `npx`) does not work.
